text: one of the most classic exercises for
the back it's also one of the most
difficult to master especially if you're
heavy is to pull up this will also work
the biceps in addition to your full back
what Anthony is going to do is he's
going to place his hands a little wider
than shoulder width apart what you want
to make sure you do want a proper
pull-up is keep the chest up and elevate
it as you're pulling up towards the bar
so that it goes up towards that upper
portion of your chest or your clavicle
notice he keeps his chest up pulls with
his back in his arms and keeps his body
nice and still while he's doing this
that's a proper pull-up until you can do
a full pull-up
one of the things that you can do is you
can use assistance one of the best ways
to do that is using a resistance band
what Anthony is doing is looping the
band over the bar and he's going to use
this to step in to ultimately in order
to provide a little additional help on
the way up during the pull-up you can
put his knee in and what this is going
to do now is as he pulls up it's going
to take some of his bodyweight off so
that he can do a full pull-up in proper
position one additional option for
assistance during the pull-up if you
don't use an assistance or resistance
band is you can actually use a spotter
proper technique for spotting in this
would be to allow Anthony to determine
how much help he really needs in order
to do that I'm going to place my hands
under his ankles and allow him to push
off me in order to finish the pull-up
that way
I'm not determining how much help he
needs what you'll see some people do is
spot from the waist or the hips and
actually try to help him up in that case
but he's not determining how much help
he needs in that case instead reach
below allow him to push off you by
providing stable base in order for him
to follow through and do a full pull up
until he can do a series on his own
without assistance
you
